channel.title: Help on picking a decent source
channel.description: Let me start by saying I don't have a lot of experience in coding servers. Although I've been here since like 2006, I haven't spent a lot of time working on sources. I have owned a few fairly successful servers back in 2008. So I have some experience but it's been a long time. Anyways, I've recently come back to the RSPS community and now I've decided I want to start up my own server! Here is what I want; I want a 317 source, I want to mix old school with new school a little bit but mainly old school, I want a relatively clean base and no customs, weapons like dragon claws and god swords, not tons of bugs I will have to spend most of my time working on, something I can work on and in the end have a unique, nice server. Any suggestions are welcome. Thanks!

item.title: Help on picking a decent source
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

@OP: Check the downloads section. Try one, if you don’t like it, change it.

I’m locking the topic before any more flaming breaks out.

Read full topic
item.source: Help on picking a decent source

item.title: Help on picking a decent source
item.dc:creator: @Sinned Sinned
item.description:
@Sinned wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:15, topic:443488”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=546170.msg4004173#msg4004173 date=1338427579]

Well start off with a delta, they are simple to code and have many features, you can add almost everything to a delta, and there are plenty of tuts, a few suggestions dont add to many custom’s to a delta thats what every new coder intends to do, after you’ve coded a delta host it, then if you want start working on a 317 getting the feel of it, its a little different then a delta but its better and more up to date.

Hyperion is better than Delta, Delta is poorly programmed. I mean, they use ints were booleans should be used, they don’t package. Hyperion is clearly the better choice.

100% bullshit right here.
You CAN package a delta.
And people code them wrong because the ones that get a hold of the deltas and release them are NOOBS!
Here is a clean and PACKAGED delta.
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,542022.0.html
Oh wait… I thought they can’t be packaged…
trolololol.

Hey, fucktard, I didn’t say they couldn’t be packaged, do you even know what a fucking package is? Or is your head too far up your asshole to even learn it? How does one “code”? I believe the term is “program” or “develop”. As I said before, Delta is horribly programmed, even the clean one. A horrible choice for starters, it seems as though your still a fucking idiot, so I guess you probably think Delta is a good choice, when it is not. @OP: Guys like this epitomize whats wrong with Moparscape. So don’t listen.

[/quote]

The term “to code” == to program. It’s easier to type.
And obviously you haven’t seen a good delta. They CAN be extremely great, assuming the one behind the computer programming it is smart enough.
Oh btw, you did say it can’t be packaged. In different terms.
I made the text red to show where.
That seems really close to “They cannot be packaged.”[/quote]
Anyone smart enough would write their own framework or use something like Hyperion, not resort to a Delta… what pro “coder” pulled the wool over your eyes?

They = the programmer, as in “they don’t bother to package it”.

Read full topic
item.source: Help on picking a decent source

item.title: Help on picking a decent source
item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

tyb97:

Hyperion is better than Delta, Delta is poorly programmed. I mean, they use ints were booleans should be used, they don’t package. Hyperion is clearly the better choice.

delta is horribly programmed, however the packaging thing doesn’t mean anything. packaging is purely for organization, it has 0 effect on the server itself

sk8r/tyb: shut up pls

@OP: i would strongly suggest getting this: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,227037.0.html and just looking over it. go through everything piece by piece, and try to understand each part

Read full topic
item.source: Help on picking a decent source

item.title: Help on picking a decent source
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:17, topic:443488”][quote author=tyb97 link=topic=546170.msg4004200#msg4004200 date=1338429241]
Well I’m sorry your parents can’t afford to send you to a good school. If they could, possibly your English comprehension would be better. Delta still sucks. Horrible for a beginner. Obviously you started with Delta or PI, which is why your still ignorant.
[/quote]

Now you are going out of your way to not only go against what I say, be rude, and make fun of my family? Seriously you need to grow the fuck up and get a new damn life. Everyone is entitled their own opinions. My opinion is delta is way better then other 317’s, just no one takes the time to fix them up correctly.
inb4 you continue your flamer rage.[/quote]

Even with a lot of work Delta would struggle to fit in with other higher performing frameworks. The difference between the two is Delta is more or less a finished product that is ready to see the world, and then the other frameworks have the tools to get started, they just don’t have the content needed to gain popularity.

Read full topic

item.title: Help on picking a decent source
item.dc:creator: @Sinned Sinned
item.description:
@Sinned wrote:

Hyperion or RuneSource. Don’t even consider Delta or PI. Start with the good stuff and you won’t forever be stuck with the bad.

@Sk8: I believe he said that Delta’s don’t come packaged (99.9% of them), implying that if he looked for one he’d only come across one that was unpackaged. Delta is still shit packaged anyway so your post invalid.

Read full topic
item.source: Help on picking a decent source

item.title: Help on picking a decent source
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Delta, devolution, PI, runesource are all based on and off of the WinterLove base, WinterLove can be a great server with work to fix the major problems it carries in it’s design. Just so you all know Apollo uses the same player updating design as a WinterLove server one of the differences it just does it in a multi-threaded approach.

You should also know if you wish to learn more and create more content on a WinterLove designed server and wish to keep some of the look and feel, then RuneSource is your pick, the real difference is that RuneSource is a high performing version then the regular older WinterLove.

Read full topic

item.title: Help on picking a decent source
item.dc:creator: @Taren Taren
item.description:
@Taren wrote:

Not sure if I made this clear in the OP but I am not a beginner. Thanks for the suggestions anyways.
I’ll be going with the utopia source of delta. Say what you will but delta is and always will be, FTW.
Also, I’ve never heard of hyperion so I was curious to check it out. IMO it’s pretty weird, and I don’t like it much.
PS: There’s no way in hell I’m going back to winterlove. I started with that shit and I can CLEARLY remember what that was like.

Read full topic

item.title: Help on picking a decent source
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

jmood128:

If a beginner wishes to learn then they should start with RuneSource, it’s based on the winterlove design as is most other servers, but it has far higher performance and doesn’t have a lot of the bad habits that you can pick up with other winterlove based servers.

Hyperion, doesn’t have bad habits inside either. @OP: RuneSource, and Hyperion are both good choices.

i am infamy:

delta is actually better because you can add more features, not only that your not wrong ty, dont get me wrong hyperion is good but for a beginner i suggest delta

How can you add more features? Java is Java. You can add everything to a delta you can to a Hyperion.

Read full topic

item.source: Help on picking a decent source

item.title: Help on picking a decent source
item.dc:creator: @Taren Taren
item.description:
@Taren wrote:

Let me start by saying I don’t have a lot of experience in coding servers. Although I’ve been here since like 2006, I haven’t spent a lot of time working on sources. I have owned a few fairly successful servers back in 2008. So I have some experience but it’s been a long time. Anyways, I’ve recently come back to the RSPS community and now I’ve decided I want to start up my own server! Here is what I want; I want a 317 source, I want to mix old school with new school a little bit but mainly old school, I want a relatively clean base and no customs, weapons like dragon claws and god swords, not tons of bugs I will have to spend most of my time working on, something I can work on and in the end have a unique, nice server.
Any suggestions are welcome.
Thanks!

Read full topic
